intro: Cissus bequaertii, commonly known as the African rock fig, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by edible, fig-like fruits. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found growing on rocky surfaces or in shaded areas. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is popular as a houseplant in tropical and subtropical regions.
